meanings.definition: To make something appear more attractive or interesting
meanings.sent1: She enjoys tarting up her room with colorful posters.
meanings.sent2: The company is tarting up their website to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: The magician was tarting up his performance with flashy lights.
meanings.sent4: The artist tarted up the plain canvas with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The chef tarted up the dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs.

meanings.definition: The act of adding a sour taste to food
meanings.sent1: The tarting of the soup with lemon juice gave it a tangy flavor.
meanings.sent2: She added vinegar for tarting to the salad dressing.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected tarting of the cake with vinegar made it inedible.
meanings.sent4: The tarting of the dish with lime juice was a pleasant surprise.
meanings.sent5: The tarting of the sauce with vinegar balanced the sweetness perfectly.

meanings.definition: A small open pastry filled with fruit or custard
meanings.sent1: She bought a delicious tarting from the bakery for dessert.
meanings.sent2: The tarting at the party was filled with fresh berries.
meanings.sent3: The tarting on the dessert table disappeared quickly.
meanings.sent4: The tarting with custard was a hit among the guests.
meanings.sent5: The tarting with apple filling was a delightful treat.
